thread.title: Kings GM: Team passed up better deal for DeMarcus Cousins 2 days ago
thread.title_full: Kings GM: Team passed up better deal for DeMarcus Cousins 2 days ago

author: USA TODAY Sports
title: Kings GM: Team passed up better deal for DeMarcus Cousins 2 days ago
text:
Kings GM: Team passed up better deal for DeMarcus Cousins 2 days ago Oh my. Post to Facebook Kings GM: Team passed up better deal for DeMarcus Cousins 2 days ago Oh my.  //ftw.usatoday.com/2017/02/vlade-divac-demarcus-cousins-trade/   Join the Nation's Conversation   Kings GM: Team passed up better deal for DeMarcus Cousins 2 days ago Nina Mandell , USA TODAY Sports 4:35 p.m. ET Feb. 20, 2017 1 Shares 
(Photo: Bill Streicher-USA TODAY Sports) 
Hear that sound across Sacramento? It's very possibly the sound of every Kings fan banging their head against the wall after watching this surreal moment in Kings GM Vlade Divac's press conference. Divac, in a show of stunning honesty, told reporters that the Kings at one point had a better offer on the table for DeMarcus Cousins than the one they ended up taking. Kings GM Vlade Divac said he had A BETTER OFFER for Boogie two days ago.But that you know, that's not the deal he made. pic.twitter.com/ZSnUSixZCo â€” Rachel Nichols (@Rachel__Nichols) February 20, 2017 
Divac was asked if there was debate among the team about waiting until closer to the trade deadline before parting with Cousins. 
He answered: "We would most likely get less. Because I had a better deal two days ago." 
Reporter: "Then what you got now?" 
Divac: "Yup." 
Reporter: "You had a better offer for Cousins two days ago?" 
Divac: "Talk to those agents, yes." Read or Share this story: http://ftw.usatoday.com/2017/02/vlade-divac-demarcus-cousins-trade/ Most Popular
